diseases.name: Gaucher Disease
diseases.description: A rare genetic disorder where a type of fat (lipid) called glucocerebroside cannot be broken down properly, accumulating in various organs.
treatment: Supportive care for bone and pain management

diseases.name: Pompe Disease
diseases.description: A disorder that disables the heart and skeletal muscles because the body cannot make a protein that breaks down glycogen.
symptoms: Progressive muscle weakness (especially in legs and trunk)
diagnosis: Enzyme Assay (GAA enzyme activity in blood/skin)
treatment: Physical Therapy to maintain muscle strength

diseases.name: Fabry Disease
diseases.description: A progressive genetic disorder where a specific type of fat builds up in the body's cells, affecting the heart, kidneys, and skin.
symptoms: Burning pain in hands and feet (Acroparesthesia)
diagnosis: Genetic Testing (GLA gene) - Required for females
treatment: Chaperone Therapy (oral medication for specific mutations)

diseases.name: Mucopolysaccharidosis (MPS)
diseases.description: A group of metabolic disorders caused by the body's inability to break down glycosaminoglycans (sugar chains).
diagnosis: Genetic Testing to confirm the specific MPS type (I, II, III, etc.)
treatment: Enzyme Replacement Therapy (ERT) for some types (MPS I, II, IVA, VI, VII)
Symptomatic management (surgery for hernias, heart valve repair)
